sub_topic: Determining the genus of a graph.
message_1: Find the genus of a complete graph K7.
message_2:
The genus of a graph is the minimum number of handles needed on a surface to draw the graph without any edge crossings. For a complete graph K_n, the genus g can be found using the formula:

g = (n - 3)(n - 4)/2

For K7, we have n = 7. Plugging this into the formula, we get:

g = (7 - 3)(7 - 4)/2 = (4)(3)/2 = 6

So, the genus of the complete graph K7 is 6.
